availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City and County of New York } ss

I, Charles Nettleton of the City County and State of New York having been appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commissioner of Deeds for the said State of Kentucky to reside within the State of New York do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties appertaining to the said office -- So help me God.

Charles Nettleton
Subscribed in my presence and sworn to before me this 11th day of April A D. 1865 as witness my hand & official Seal.

Arch W Speir
Notary Public
In & for New York City

figure.ab:
ARCH W. SPEIR
NOTARY PUBLIC
NEW YORK

body.p:
Comr Deeds
New York
Oath of
Chas Nettleton filed 17th Apl/65
